item.title: General
item.description: This details the general usage of the CardFunc API.

item.title: Test data
item.description:
When testing our system, don’t use real card data. Instead, use one of the following test card PANs:

  • 4111111111111111
  • 2221000000000009
  • 5500000000000004

CVC is 987 for each of these numbers.

item.title: Example JS
item.description: const response = await fetch("https://api.cardfunc.com/authorization", { method: "POST", headers: { Authentication: "Bearer <public.api.key>" } body: JSON.stringify( { "number": "<unique order identifier>", "amount": 1337.42, "currency": "SEK", "account": "<account token>" } ) }

item.title: Authorization using CardFunc Element
item.description: To provide a user interface for an end-user to enter sensitive card information the CardFunc Element is used.

item.title: Developer Focus
item.description: We put programmers first. That is why all your integration questions are answered by our developers directly. No first line support staff to try to get past.

item.title: List authorizations
item.description: The List endpoint is used to list previously created authorizations.

item.title: Authorization using Account Token
item.description: When the same customer performs multiple payments over time, an account token can be used instead of entering the card data time and time again.

item.title: Example Curl
item.description: curl -X POST https://api.cardfunc.com/authorization \ -u "Bearer <public.api.key>" \ -d "number=<your order identifier>" \ -d "amount=1337.42" \ -d "currency=SEK" \ -d "account=<account token>"

item.title: Capture
item.description: The capture endpoint is used for performing capture, using an authorization.

item.title: Be Productive
item.description: Easy to integrate API:s make you more productive so you can focus on creating your innovation.

item.title: Cloud First
item.description: Our solutions are designed for the requirements of modern cloud based applications. Payments can be initiated directly from the client code and be confirmed for authenticity without any need to double check with our servers first.

item.title: Cancel
item.description: The Cancel endpoint is used to cancel the authorization to withdraw a reserved amount. If capture has already been performed on the authorization, cancelling the authorization will not refund the amount. For that, the refund endpoint should be used.

item.title: Grow With Us
item.description: Don’t become irrelevant customer for a big company. As a smaller, fast growing company, every customer matters to us.

item.title: Authorization using PAN
item.description: Authorizations can be created using PAN directly. This approach adds many requirements in order to comply with PCI DSS-rules and is not recommended for most customers, however.

item.title: Refund authorization
item.description: The refund endpoint is used for refunding an amount that has already been captured, using an authorization.

item.title: Get Started
item.description: Use the “Contact Us” tab in the lower right corner to get in direct contact with us and we help you get you started with your project.

item.title: Data type reference
item.description: The Reference section describes data types used in requests to and responses from the CardFunc API.

item.title: Thank You
item.description: Thank you for reaching out. We will get back to you with our response.
